intro: Cotula dispersa, commonly known as the common groundsel, is a small, annual herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters and has hairy, linear to lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from late winter to early spring. Cotula dispersa is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and fields. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads.
